limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum number of objects in array. Default is 25. Maximum is 100.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Object offset for pagination. Default is 0.

oauth_2_0.name: oauth_2_0
oauth_2_0.description:
The Twitch API uses the OAuth 2.0 protocol for simple, but effective
authentication and authorization. The one thing to keep in mind is tha
all requests to the API must be made over SSL (https:// not http://)

access_token.name: access_token
access_token.description:
Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use together with
the "Authorization" header

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description:
Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use together with
the "access_token" queryParameters string parameter.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Basic information about the API and authentication status. If you are authenticated, the response includes the status of your token and links to other related resources.

application/json.name: application/json
application/json.example:
{
  "name" : "test_user1" ,
  "game" : "World of Warcraft: Cataclysm" ,

broadcasts.name: broadcasts
broadcasts.description: Returns only broadcasts when true. Otherwise only highlights are returned. Default is false.

methods.description: Returns an list of videos ordered by time of creation, starting with the most recent from :channel.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Get channel's list of following users
Resets channel's stream key.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity if commercial length not allowed.

length.name: length
length.description:
Length of commercial break in seconds. Default value is 30.
Valid values are 30, 60, or 90. You may only trigger a commercial longer than 30 seconds once every 8 minutes.

methods.description: Start a commercial on channel

application/json.name: application/json

direction.name: direction
direction.description: Creation date sorting direction. Default is asc. Valid values are asc and desc.

methods.description: Returns a list of subscription objects sorted by subscription relationship creation date which contain users subscribed to :channel.

application/json.name: application/json

404.description: Not Found if user is not subscribed.

methods.description: Returns a subscription object which includes the user if that user is subscribed. Requires authentication for :channel.

channel.name: channel
channel.description: Streams from a comma separated list of channels.

embeddable.description: If set to true, only returns streams that can be embedded

hls.name: hls

methods.description: Returns a user object.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Returns a list of blocks objects on :login's block list. List sorted by recency, newest first.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Adds :target to :user's block list. :user is the authenticated user and :target is user to be blocked. Returns a blocks object.

404.description: Not Found if :target not on :user's block list.

methods.description: Removes :target from :user's block list. :user is the authenticated user and :target is user to be unblocked.

application/json.name: application/json

404.description: Not Found if :user does not exist.

methods.description: Returns a list of follows objects.

application/json.name: application/json

404.description: Not Found if user is not following channel.

methods.description: Returns a follow object otherwise.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Adds :user to :target's followers. :user is the authenticated user's name and :target is the name of the channel to be followed.
Removes :user from :target's followers. :user is the authenticated user's name and :target is the name of the channel to be unfollowed.

503.description: Service Unavailable if unable to retrieve search results.

query.name: query
query.description: query or q. A url-encoded search query.

methods.description: Returns a list of stream objects matching the search query.

application/json.name: application/json

query.name: query
query.description: query or q. A url-encoded search query.

type.name: type
type.description: suggest: Suggests a list of games similar to query, e.g. 'star' query might suggest 'StarCraft II: Wings of Liberty'.

live.name: live
live.description: If true, only returns games that are live on at least one channel.

methods.description: Returns a list of game objects matching the search query.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Returns a list of active teams.

application/json.name: application/json

methods.description: Returns a team object for :team.

methods.description: Returns a video object.

application/json.name: application/json

period.name: period
period.description: Returns only videos created in time period. Valid values are week, month, or all. Default is week.

methods.description: Returns a list of videos created in a given time period sorted by number of views, most popular first.

documentation.title: Headline
documentation.content: The Twitch API enables you to develop your own applications using the rich feature set that we provide. Features include retrieving data about what streams are live, changing information about specific channels, and doing an SSO integration with Twitch.
